New Records: Sese Bau became the 2nd Papua New Guinea batter to hit a fifty in the T20 World Cup
Key Match Events: Romario Shepherd initiated the damage early, claiming the wicket of Tony Ura in the second over
Akeal Hosein capitalized on the momentum, dismissing number three batsman Lega Siaka
Alzarri Joseph struck, sending their skipper Assad Vala back to the pavilion
Sese Bau fell, PNG struggled to accelerate, managing to inch closer to a defendable total
Pre-Game Insights: WI captain Rovman Powell won the toss and chose to bowl vs Papua New Guinea
Post-Match Reflections: Sese Bau etched his name into Papua New Guinea cricket history by becoming the second batter from his country to score a fifty in the T20 World Cup match against the West Indies
Miscellaneous Highlights: PNG, making their second T20 World Cup appearance, faced an uphill battle from the outset
The West Indies bowlers, particularly their spinners, exploited the pitch conditions effectively
Others: Sese Bau's innings was marked by fluency and aggression against a formidable West Indian bowling attack
Bau dispatched three of those boundaries off Gudakesh Motie in a single over, underlining his dominance and timing
